definition: to flood/to submerge/to drown/to irritate the skin (of liquids)/to delay
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: They attempted to use sand package to barricade the floods, but was useless.
sentences.chinese: 他们尝试用沙包来阻挡淹水可是却没效。

sentences.english: Floodplain is a seasonally inundated micro-geography on plain riverbed.
sentences.chinese: 滩地是平原河床季节性淹水的微地形。

sentences.english: Bad drainage caused the land to be flooded.
sentences.chinese: 排水不利容易使土地淹水。

sentences.english: The paper discussed flooded days and areas of beach wetlands in Dongting Lake.
sentences.chinese: 研究了洞庭湖洲滩地年淹水天数和面积变化。

sentences.english: Submergence stress result in oxygen limitation in maize roots.
sentences.chinese: 玉米幼苗受淹水胁迫导致根系缺氧。

sentences.english: Days of torrential rain in Prachuap County, Thailand, caused severe flooding.
sentences.chinese: 泰国巴蜀县，连日豪雨淹水成灾。

sentences.english: The effect of intermittent flood upon the radial variation of tracheid features of Taxodium ascendens was investigated.
sentences.chinese: 研究间歇性淹水对池杉木材管胞形态变异的影响。

sentences.english: An ample water supply is probably the greatest advantage of soil submergence for irrigated rice.
sentences.chinese: 大量供水可能对灌溉水稻淹水土壤有很大好处。

sentences.english: The typhoon caused chaos in the flooded area.
sentences.chinese: 台风在淹水的地区引起了混乱。

definition: (of a circuit breaker or switch) to trip
Taiwu township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
